Posted By: DaLucaray (1/28/2014 5:02:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's good that this has 1 toughness, like Bob, so that if drawing only one card a turn becomes a problem, have it block anything (and kill a fair bit with that nasty 3 power) and you may draw all the cards you like.  
  
Also, I'd like to point out that Bob, [Pain Seer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pain Seer), and [Stoneforge Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoneforge Mystic) put cards into your hand, but they don't draw them. \*ALLTHESYNERGIES\*  
  
@sweetgab  
[Notion Thief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Notion Thief) plus this wouldn't work because you would skip the draw as well. Nobody would draw anything from [Whispering Madness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispering Madness) either, so you'd have to get quite the board presence before you combo off.
posts.html:
It's good that this has 1 toughness, like Bob, so that if drawing only one card a turn becomes a problem, have it block anything (and kill a fair bit with that nasty 3 power) and you may draw all the cards you like.

Also, I'd like to point out that Bob, Pain Seer, and Stoneforge Mystic put cards into your hand, but they don't draw them. *ALLTHESYNERGIES*

@sweetgab
Notion Thief plus this wouldn't work because you would skip the draw as well. Nobody would draw anything from Whispering Madness either, so you'd have to get quite the board presence before you combo off.

Posted By: SirLibraryEater (1/29/2014 3:27:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: If the Oracle text for an action doesn't use the word "draw", it is not card drawing, and specifically, "put into your hand" is the standard Magic way of saying "this does not count as drawing a card". So yes, the abilities of Domri and six-mana Garruk circumvent Sprit's ability.
posts.html:
If the Oracle text for an action doesn't use the word "draw", it is not card drawing, and specifically, "put into your hand" is the standard Magic way of saying "this does not count as drawing a card". So yes, the abilities of Domri and six-mana Garruk circumvent Sprit's ability.

posts.post_content:
I would prefer Thalia, myself. Has a definite spot in D&T, but in the environments it's most effective in, you also get the most ease of making it not a problem.  
  
I'm not being a DIES TO REMOVAL 0/5 idiot here, I hope, but what I mean is that considering the environments such an effect is going to have most impact for, it's not a format-shaking silver bullet like some seem to think. Thalia at least taxes their efforts to get rid of her, and First Strike goes a long way. This is a very controlling, even prison-y card, and that kind of fragility is exactly what decks that control/prison archetypes hit can deal with most easily.  
  
What I'd want it for? **Stax**. You're already throttling their ability to do anything at all, choking their ability to possibly draw a solution (given the abundance of 1 mana draw spells, which means any land of theirs that slips out of your control can be annoying) may be worth considering. Plus, the 3/1 body is very effective against opponents with nonexist... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Thalia at least taxes their efforts to get rid of her, and First Strike goes a long way. This is a very controlling, even prison-y card, and that kind of fragility is exactly what decks that control/prison archetypes hit can deal with most easily.

What I'd want it for? Stax. You're already throttling their ability to do anything at all, choking their ability to possibly draw a solution (given the abundance of 1 mana draw spells, which means any land of theirs that slips out of your control can be annoying) may be worth considering. Plus, the 3/1 body is very effective against opponents with nonexist... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Strangely, does not hose [Jace, Architect of Thought](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, Architect of Thought), [Domri Rade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Domri Rade), [Garruk, Caller of Beasts](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk, Caller of Beasts), or [Chandra, Pyromaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra, Pyromaster). [Underworld Connections](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Underworld Connections) also tends to get around her. Pretty much she only interacts with [Sphinx's Revelation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx's Revelation) (can still draw one), [Divination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divination), and [Bident of Thassa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bident of Thassa) in Standard.  
  
What about an Esper deck featuring this, [Notion Thief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Notion Thief) and [Whispering Madness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispering Madness)? It nukes everyone's hand pretty much.   
  
Edit: Yeah I meant Spirit combos with Madness, and Notion Thief also combos with Madness, the latter in a much better way. Spirit doesn't combo with Thief, but it's good to have redundancy for your combos.
posts.html:
Strangely, does not hose Jace, Architect of Thought, Domri Rade, Garruk, Caller of Beasts, or Chandra, Pyromaster. Underworld Connections also tends to get around her. Pretty much she only interacts with Sphinx's Revelation (can still draw one), Divination, and Bident of Thassa in Standard.

What about an Esper deck featuring this, Notion Thief and Whispering Madness? It nukes everyone's hand pretty much.

Edit: Yeah I meant Spirit combos with Madness, and Notion Thief also combos with Madness, the latter in a much better way. Spirit doesn't combo with Thief, but it's good to have redundancy for your combos.
